740D0C9594B144B69C272D46CBC809FD.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

DDFC039C5DBA4A6294DCCE74D4322FFF.description: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.

BE038A911CE94F2D9C9127AD69101D14.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

D687A5894AC94C798B8DFAA769414DD7.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

235A004F66EF4291AF7A48260FD2C793.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

516913A19D9E490ABD97A0508FBECAC5.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.

819D54F8EF58416FA16DCC430E874D40.description: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

C9C63B6C7A684893933BD09C87C3CAB0.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

DE2CE890AB6444B99AEB628EBBD4C8DA.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

2332AE177A514EA9A58879298922A998.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

744F24CEB0734088A663C4D4046BFEA6.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, metacognition/self- correction, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

6072172707724FBFBA0728DB5AF67321.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

77BB148AAC3940B780A83B33565604CC.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

D78BE3959D514B33BF6680F3A852AE63.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning; flexibly making editing and revision choices and sustaining effort to complete complex writing tasks; and focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

C276C059978D4BABACBCA4356E431901.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

9B63324659304AC2A04F8D8B96E1AED0.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

A8025F1698D047B6B646343D64829363.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

8640493B04A64F6DBFF0D30CB885535C.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

95D2CF6BD0494E0A8B07AD30DE4B300D.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

9743B0176B4C4EA48B0096AD803A2D16.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

0A9F78F028294786A60FB415FAFE2DC3.description: Provide a concluding statement or section (e.g., sentence, part of a paragraph, paragraph, or multiple paragraphs) that follows the flow of ideas, reflects back on the topic, and supports the information or explanation presented.

6BB3B9F4BAEB4B7C98306907426FE312.description: Establish and maintain a formal style academic style, approach, and form.

428CA1F0F2864808A4E43E4261DAB81C.description: Use precise language and domain/ grade-level- specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

9803C32519BB4B18B93852785B1C0329.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

9923EC724DD6466E837C47D4609F88CB.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

04600485571945ECA71CD86B42010630.description: Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using text structures (e.g., definition, classification, comparison/contrast, cause/effect, etc.) and text features (e.g., headings, graphics, and multimedia) when useful to aid in comprehension.

5DD97F43E5224FCBA8E21E5677028F3B.description: Write informative/explanatory texts (including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes) to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

249E05EDE08646B99664FB34A8081D37.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

009AF5FD2A314A94AD0C5FD76074677E.description: Establish and maintain a formal style/academic style, approach, and form.

13D85F8F756F4696847AAB2554A2BED8.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

A481DBCFE1134019B9CB43F2B98D08E8.description: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant, accurate data and evidence that demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text, using credible sources.

D313C1F4E6B947BCB7406FD9CE0511A3.description: Introduce claim(s) about a topic or issue, acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

C6194E268C444040B6E517B5C9F88FE4.description: Write arguments on discipline-specific content (e.g., social studies, science, technical subjects, English/Language Arts) to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

6218AE1DB3C54809B2ECACE788B1D2BE.description: Analyze and reflect on (e.g., practical knowledge, historical/cultural context, and background knowledge) how two or more authors writing informational texts about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

68EC3D9DE4E74AB1B1D3A9D0F6D84E3B.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of an event, time, place, or character and a historical or scientific account of the same period or event as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history and/or events.

25374E956C074B4AA17C0C8B38ED84B3.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

1FD08379C26D4BACA053A2C5FAD59F1D.description: Compare and contrast texts to analyze the unique qualities of different mediums, including the integration of information from multiple formats and sources to develop deeper understanding of the concept, topic or subject and resolve conflicting information.

02CA4031C4F245229D9BD5973657CB6F.description: Compare and contrast texts (e.g., a written story, drama, or poem) to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version and analyze the unique qualities of different mediums, including the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

AFB103B53E0344D485CFF05E1178A480.description: Determine how an author conveys or develops perspective or purpose in a text through distinguishing their position from that of others using evidence.

1BFD024C740B41689901274B4393B0C3.description: Determine how an author conveys or develops perspective or purpose in a text through contrasting the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

316597F41E404C20A88B61342ABC1659.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text and how it contributes to the text as a whole, including using knowledge of text structures (e.g., cause-effect, proposition-support) and genre features (e.g., graphics, captions, indexes) to organize and analyze important information.

82BE9BB8B7BF433E958BF50F50B81E79.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text and how it contributes to the text as a whole, including how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

2B61E104204949B7B456D2220BAC0CD2.description: Analyze how particular elements of a text interact including how a text makes connections and distinctions among individuals, events, and ideas (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

67AE2457DF1443DA850AAEA55FE8064C.description: Analyze how particular elements of a text interact including how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

799E04561B104A3E93E2C0C98A70B04F.description: Determine a central idea in an informational text and explain how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

6F8F71D8918A40FC934FA696262F6AD4.description: Determine a theme in a literary text (e.g., stories, plays or poetry) and explain how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

8D773BDAD3C941C5BD58C4B0199D6996.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence and make relevant connections to support analysis of what an informational text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

961233D1EFD343FDA26848C64AFB5786.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence and make relevant connections to support analysis of what a literary text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

C7BFE1C002864890A0E702F31DDBF530.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

613A1875DD8D4C52AD192EF2102EEAF0.description: Analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sound (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza or a poem or section of a story or drama.

D1468A5204CE4F38A8ADEC7412C672EB.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

7D336C73A53B49F9953CB32DC5A2BA26.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

14CD37DF014A4F4CBA234C77C56ACEC5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

3C7C0B55243549F99A2C6DF6AACBA1F3.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

50FAFE378D4D42E0BE31F3FE86B8E60C.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

2CD7503A69BB4542AB201EB5DA17AFF5.description: Analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

485EE9C8EB4845648D0CC77291DE0DDF.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

E51832797FC44FD18DA9F3284AD901D1.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

DF01C3DEDD8B489690CE62550C1DEAC9.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, including technical meanings, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

234C2A69197F43C9B2E441AEB9990C04.description: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

51047008984745DD97A0F01B92743626.description: Gather vocabulary knowledge when selecting a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

3325642CEC814C1380FA11A4DDE8D7C0.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases.

E4616059BB4B438EA6AFCF9AC5DA429F.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

DC3B2D0BA45645A2A4BA27297F5DEDDF.description: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old green shirt).

D86AF7A281C447C792A062B3FA7A3EC7.description: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

F06D6130035D4A7A99B08F5B3071F1EF.description: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

4EDB311DB14942F4B5045285141445ED.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

7CBF0B3F660A48AB9B7932D49755D7BD.description: Demonstrate command of the system and structure of the English language when writing or speaking.
